stem: Зачем использовать dry, clean compressed air for PAC?

choices.text: Wet, oily air extends consumable life
Dry, clean air уменьшает wear and улучшает cut quality
Nitrogen — always required instead of air

rationales.CHOICE-2: Moisture and oil contaminate the plasma stream and damage consumables.

stem: Что is the benefit of using dry, clean compressed air for PAC (переменный ток)?

choices.text: Dry, clean air уменьшает wear and улучшает cut quality
Nitrogen is required instead of air

rationales.CHOICE-2: Moisture/oil contaminate the plasma and damage расходников.

stem: Excessive вылета/зазора/gap in PAC (переменный ток) typically:

choices.text: Stretches the arc, increasing bevel and dross

rationales.CHOICE-2: Too much gap увеличиваетs bevel angle and slag.

stem: A sign PAC (переменный ток) расходников need replacement is:

choices.text: Erratic arc, widening пропил (kerf), and dross

rationales.CHOICE-2: Worn parts cause unstable arcs and poor cuts.

stem: Heavy bottom dross is usually a sign of:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Slow travel allows molten metal to solidify along the lower edge.

stem: Heavy bottom пригар — usually a sign of что?

rationales.CHOICE-2: Slow travel lets molten metal solidify on the lower edge, forming heavy пригар.

stem: Due to пропил (kerf) angle in PAC (переменный ток), a good practice is to place the 'good side' of the cut:

choices.text: On the side where squareness is most critical
Opposite the direction of travel always

rationales.CHOICE-2: Plan cut direction so the squarer edge is on the finished side.

stem: Due to пропил (kerf) angle in PAC (переменный ток), a good practice is to place the 'good side' of the cut:

choices.text: On the side where squareness is most critical

rationales.CHOICE-2: Plan cut direction so the squarer edge is on the finished side.

stem: Prominent линиий отставания (lag lines) trailing far behind the torch usually indicate:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Excess speed увеличиваетs lag/drag lines; adjust speed or current.

stem: Хороший приём for piercing with PAC (переменный ток) is to:

choices.text: Pierce at cut height to save time
Pierce at a higher pierce height, then lower to cut height

rationales.CHOICE-2: Higher pierce height protects расходников from molten blowback.

stem: В чём преимущество пилотной дуги or ВЧ‑поджига in PAC (переменный ток)?

choices.text: Requires scraping the nozzle on the work
Initiates the arc without dragging the nozzle

rationales.CHOICE-2: Non-contact starts protect the nozzle and improve reliability.

stem: Какая полярность is typical for air plasma cutting systems?

rationales.CHOICE-2: Air plasma torches commonly use DCEN (прямая полярность) (electrode negative).

stem: Как следует torch standoff be managed in plasma arc cutting (PAC)?

choices.text: Always drag the наконечник regardless of torch design
Maintain the proper standoff/drag per the torch to protect consumables

rationales.CHOICE-2: Верно standoff предотвращает сопло damage and preserves cut quality.

stem: Как следует torch вылета/зазора be managed in plasma arc cutting (PAC (переменный ток))?

choices.text: Всегда drag the сопла regardless of design
Maintain the proper вылета/зазора/drag per torch design to protect расходников

rationales.CHOICE-2: Correct вылета/зазора предотвращает nozzle damage and preserves cut quality.

stem: Что — the advantage of pilot-arc or HF start in PAC?

choices.text: They require scraping the сопло on the work
They initiate the arc without dragging the сопло
They уменьшить the need for shielding

rationales.CHOICE-2: Non-контактный starts protect the сопло and улучшить reliability.
